cnbc.title: U.S. government takes 10% stake in Intel, as Trump expands control over private sector
cnbc.summary: Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick said that the U.S. government has taken a 10% stake in chipmaker Intel.

cnbc.title: Trump says furniture tariffs are coming later this year
cnbc.summary: Stocks for some furniture and home goods companies, including Wayfair, RH and Williams-Sonoma, tumbled after the market close, following Trump's post.

cnbc.title: Ether notches first new record since 2021 after Powell speech teasing rate cuts
cnbc.summary: The price of ether smashed through its 2021 record on Friday after Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell hinted at upcoming rate cuts.

cnbc.title: Ghislaine Maxwell interview released by DOJ; Epstein procurer questioned about Trump
cnbc.summary: The Trump administration has been criticized for reneging on promises to release files about sex offenders Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.

cnbc.title: Meta to unveil Hypernova smart glasses with a display, wristband at Connect next month
cnbc.summary: Meta's glasses are codenamed Hypernova and will include a small display in the right lens of the device, people familiar with the matter told CNBC.

cnbc.title: Google shares rise on report of Apple using Gemini for Siri
cnbc.summary: The reported talks have been for a potential AI deal between the two giants.

cnbc.title: Powell indicates conditions 'may warrant' interest rate cuts as Fed proceeds 'carefully'
cnbc.summary: Powell on Friday gave a tepid indication of possible cuts ahead as he noted a high level of uncertainty.

cnbc.title: Canada drops many of its retaliatory tariffs on the U.S.
cnbc.summary: Canada announced Friday it was dropping many of its retaliatory tariffs on U.S. goods, though the 25% counter-tariff on autos, steel and aluminum remains.

cnbc.title: Inside Texas Instruments' $60 billion U.S. megaproject, where Apple will make iPhone chips
cnbc.summary: Apple committed to making iPhone chips at Texas Instruments' new U.S. factories. CNBC got an exclusive first look inside TI's $60 billion megaproject.

cnbc.title: Wage growth is doing something odd in 2025 — the last time it happened was around the Great Recession
cnbc.summary: Job "switchers" generally see wages grow at a faster pace than those who stay in their current role. However, that trend has reversed.
